intro: Erigeron solisaltator, commonly known as the sun-thrower fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron solisaltator is known for its ability to thrive in full sun and well-drained soils.
